document.masterDocTitle: The millipede genus Megaphyllum Verhoeff, 1894 in the Balkan Peninsula, with description of new species (Myriapoda: Diplopoda: Julida: Julidae)

Remarks. Widespread
Megaphyllum
species, sometimes found in high abundance, and occasionally with typical millipede swarming ( e.g.
Verhoeff 1900
;
Schubart 1940
;
Ćurčiċ & Makarov 1995
;
Korsós 1998
). It can be found in diverse habitats such as caves, urban environments, forests and grasslands.
Attems ( 1940 )
regarded it as the type species of the subgenus
Chromatoiulus
Verhoeff, 1894 a
(since Verhoeff offered no type designation ( 1894 a)).

In comparison to
Strasser ( 1967 )
we can add the following observations: longitudinal line not always yellow but white; length of adult males as by
Strasser ( 1967 )
(male length given as – 20–27mm , our data: 21.6–25.1mm , one exceptionally large male was 33.7mm long), but body diameter smaller (male height given as 1.8–2.3mm , our data: 1.6–2mm , one exceptionally large male was 2.5mm wide). Females were not detailed by
Strasser ( 1967 )
, data of the investigated females are: length 20.2–29.6mm , height 2–2.6mm . Our data (overlapping distribution, differences in body, gonopods, vulvae) support
Strasser ( 1967 )
, i.e . a separate species status for
M. unilineatum
,
M. hercules
and
M. rhodopinum
.
